text: I have a really simple technique that I
think you're gonna love I'm making a
crust for my tilapia that I'm gonna bake
and the base of the crust is mayonnaise
it's delicious
it adds a tang eNOS and moistness it
lets the herbs that I'm gonna put on top
and here I have three tablespoons of
mayonnaise that I'm dividing between my
seasoned fish this is tilapia but any
firm-fleshed fish that you find that's
about three quarters to an inch thick
would be great here just arrange them in
a single layer on a baking sheet and
then spread the mayonnaise out covering
as much of the fish as you can set that
aside first egg and chop up some herbs I
have a half a cup of fresh flat-leaf
parsley leaves and a couple tablespoons
of dill you could use whatever kind of
herbs you like you can choose one over
the other I do like a combination of
parsley with other herbs just because it
cuts the intensity of the flavor I guess
what you call it make sure your oven is
preheating to 375 degrees sprinkle the
herbs evenly over your fish and you
seasoned your fish first so you you're
seasoning from the ground up which is
really really important when you're
cooking these need to bake until they're
cooked through and they flake when
pierced with the tip of a knife about 15
minutes a delicious fresh fish dinner in
20 minutes or less I say yes what do you
say
you
